{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3528566,"name":"","username":"theManInBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T06:11:18.475Z","cooked":"

So we have a 2 stage elevator with a driveshaft powered by 2 NEOs each with its own respective Spark Max. When we attempted to test the elevator, one of the NEO spontaneously started smoking while its Spark Max displayed a solid green full forward state. The other NEO and its Spark Max was fine and remained cold.

As a safety measure I had placed both on 20 amp REV breakers powered by the pdh, wiring polarity and configurations were proper at the time. Currently we dont know what may have caused this or what the issue is exactly, but any advice would help.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-16T06:11:18.475Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":140.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491908,"topic_slug":"neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68505,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward/491908/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3528568,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T06:16:48.636Z","cooked":"

it would help to know what else was happening at the time, like, were both motors stalled (e.g. holding the elevator still), and for how long?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-16T06:16:48.636Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":63.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491908,"topic_slug":"neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward/491908/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3528710,"name":"","username":"theManInBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T15:22:53.716Z","cooked":"

The elevator did not budge at all, we simply heard a click and began seeing smoke from the left motor. We broke the circuit with the circuit breaker the moment we saw smoke.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-16T15:22:53.716Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":30.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491908,"topic_slug":"neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68505,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward/491908/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3528735,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T15:58:31.501Z","cooked":"

the clicking sound was probably one of the breakers tripping. the usual breakers respond in a delayed way to overcurrent:

revrobotics.com

REV-11-1860-1863-DS.pdf

150.67 KB

so you could have simply heated the motor too hot.

it’s also possible to mess up the neo/sparkmax system in various ways, like plugging the phases in wrong, or breaking one or more of the tiny sensor wires, or allowing the motor to get too hot and thus damaging the internal sensors. a damaged motor can damage a controller, and vise versa. a motor can be partially damaged but still partially work, so you may not have noticed in the past.

one good way to handle issues like these is to use the sparkmax capabilities for current limiting and measurement. it’s harder to mess up if you are watching and limiting what the controller is doing.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-16T15:58:31.501Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491908,"topic_slug":"neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/content/docs/REV-11-1860-1863-DS.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward/491908/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529052,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T21:33:02.079Z","cooked":"
truher:

so you could have simply heated the motor too hot.

Is there a chance the neo lost a magnet? I seem to recall that as an issue early on in the v1.0 product cycle, although a quick search only turns this up, so I am not sure if it was a fever dream:

REV Robotics - 2022/23 Product Releases & Updates General Forum
Recently we have been having issues with the shafts of our neo 1.1’s coming loose on our swerve. This also causes other problems like the magnet glue melting and eventually the magnets coming loose and out of place due to the added friction created by the loose shaft rubbing against the neo internals. So far we have had to trash more than 2 motors because of this problem and we don’t really want to just throw motors at it without knowing if it is our swerve that is the problem or the neos themse…

Or maybe the neo ate something it shouldn’t?

Fun With Neos, and Shaft Keys Technical
Today At our meeting we where putting a 8mm to Hex adapter on a neo shaft. While taking it off we lost a shaft key and could not find it anywhere on the floor. I picked up the neo and shook it and we could hear a rattle noise coming from inside of it. We opened up the casing and found the Shaft key stuck to the magnets inside. We think that it must have slipped through the screw holes and inside of the neo. [IMG_7980]
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-16T21:36:25.853Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":38.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491908,"topic_slug":"neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/fun-with-neos-and-shaft-keys/433827","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Fun With Neos, and Shaft Keys","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/rev-robotics-2022-23-product-releases-updates/417743/766","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"REV Robotics - 2022/23 Product Releases & Updates","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/neo-started-smoking-while-spark-max-showing-full-forward/491908/5","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529079,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T22:03:25.445Z","cooked":"

Train of thought:

  1. You have probably killed not just your NEO, but your SPARK MAX. (NEO 1.x can dump battery voltage over the encoder lines, which the SPARK MAX wasn’t hardened against. Later designs, like the Talon FXS, Thrifty Nova, and SPARK Flex, added protections on this.) Replace both, and plan to get them recycled as e-waste.
  2. If you’re being thorough, replace the maybe-tripped breaker as well. It’s easier to trip a breaker that’s tripped once.
  3. I’d investigate whether your other NEO got any control signal at all.
  4. If the robot is powered (and disabled!), is your not-dead NEO providing any braking force? If the robot is off, is there binding in your system?
  5. We’ve smoked some motors trying to be too gentle with a system in testing. It’s counterintuitive, but if it can’t beat static friction it may heat up a phase too much.

What gear/chain reduction do you have? Did the elevator move under the power of the other motor? Maybe post a picture…
